Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) \ = \ e^{i\omega t} \\), where \\( \omega \\) is a constant frequency. We examine the effect of a linear transformation defined by the matrix \\( M \\) applied to \\( z(t) \\) at different times.

If at a certain later time \\( t_1 \\), a new transformation matrix \\( N \\) is applied as an intervention, will the resultant function form at t = T depend solely on the initial matrix \\( M \\) applied at t = 0?
Explanation: The intervention with a new transformation matrix \\( N \\) at time \\( t_1 \\) introduces another level of modification. This makes the function form at time T dependent on both \\( M \\) and \\( N \\), as the combined effect of both transformations will dictate the resultant function's characteristics.
